context: The first institute of madrasa education was at <a0_0>the <b5_0>estate of Hazrat Zaid bin Arkam<b5_0/><a0_0/> near a hill called Safa, where <a1_0><b6_0>Hazrat Muhammad<b6_0/><a1_0/> was the teacher and the students were some of his followers.[citation needed] After Hijrah (migration) the madrasa of "Suffa" was established in Madina on the east side of the Al-Masjid an-Nabawi mosque. <a2_0><b7_0>Hazrat 'Ubada bin Samit<b7_0/><a2_0/> was appointed there by Hazrat Muhammad as teacher and among the students.[citation needed] In the curriculum of the madrasa, there were teachings of The Qur'an,The <b8_0>Hadith<b8_0/>, fara'iz, tajweed, genealogy, treatises of first aid, etc. There were also trainings of horse-riding, art of war, handwriting and <a3_0>calligraphy<a3_0/>, <a4_0>athletics and <b9_0>martial arts<b9_0/><a4_0/>. The first part of madrasa based education is estimated from the first day of "nabuwwat" to the first portion of the "Umaiya" caliphate.[citation needed]
